channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Ongoing Issue With Rubbish Being Left in Car Park, 15th November
item.description:
I am writing to report an ongoing issue in our car park. For the past few weeks, individuals have been leaving bin bags on the ground instead of disposing of them properly. These bags are often dropped late in the evening when no one is around, and by the next morning foxes have torn them open. This is resulting in dirty nappies and general litter being spread across the entire area, creating an unhygienic and unpleasant environment. Could the council please investigate this matter and take appropriate action? Any support—such as increased monitoring, signage, or enforcement—would be greatly appreciated to help prevent this from continuing. Thank you for your attention to this issue.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Allenby Road, Thamesmead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped household rubbish, 15th November
item.description:
This is disgraceful. As usual residents have dumped their waste by the loiter bin.which is overflowing. Lots of this rubbish could have been recycled. It is appalling that people do this. Foxes have now had a party and it is everywhere.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Nevill Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Fly Tipping, 15th November
item.description:
The scum have been out overnight again dumping their rubbish. Bags, suitcase and mattress this time. Please look at the all the previous reports in this particular spot. Something needs to be done here, like CCTV. All the while you collect it, the filth will keep dumping it.

item.title: Leaves ankle deep on the pavement, 15th November
item.description:
According to Southwark's 2025 leafing schedule, Norway Gate was due to be swept in w/c 3 and w/c 10 November. As today's attached photos show, this has not happened in either week and the leaves on the pavement (together with fallen crab apples beneath them) are now forming a pedestrian hazard

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Norway Gate, Rotherhithe, London Borough of Southwark
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead foxes by roadside / near private property gate, 15th November
item.description:
Last night we heard motorbikes outside and then this morning found dead foxes. Members of the public have moved them of the road onto the pavement/ steps. very graphic.

item.title: Van perpetually parked on the pavement, 15th November
item.description:
This van is parked fully on the pavement, forcing pedestrians to step into the road. Wheelchair users and people with pushchairs can’t pass at all without going into traffic. I see this van parked like this most weekdays at around 6:15am and 7:30am on my way to and from the gym.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Ravens Way, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet
